page.title: 16HIGH HURSTWOOD TRANSPORT
page.content: In the very severe winter of l984/5 roads in the village suffered frost damage which is now being repaired.The roads are inadequate for the increase in traffic. Public transport in High Hurstwood consists of 2 buses a week, allowing only 2 hours in Uckfield for shopping etc. A voluntary organisation known as Helping Hands has been formed to assist those who need to visit doctors or hospitals but have no transport of their own. The hourly buses to Brighton and Tunbridge Wells along the A26 serve the residents of Herons Ghyll. Sweethaws has no buses at all. The Local Authority provides a coach or taxis to take secondary school children to school in Crowborough or Uckfield.
